solution.text:
After change of strategy, new ratio of defenders to midfielders to strikers is 4:3:3.
Hence, number of strikers = (Ratio of strikers/total ratio) x number of students in the squad, = (3/(4+3+3)) x 30 = 9
Similarly, number of midfielders = (Ratio of midfielders/total ratio) x number of students in the squad, = (3/(4+3+3)) x 30 = 9
Number of attacking players from 8th standard = 2+1 = 3.
Hence, number of attacking players not from 8th standard = total number of strikers + total number of midfielders - number of attacking players from 8th standard.
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, number of attacking players not in 8th standard = 9 +9 -3 = 15

content.text: If he changes his strategy to make the ratio of players to 4:3:3, what is the total number of attacking players (Midfielders and Strikers) that are not in 8th standard?
